body:
Honeywell International is a $37 billion diversified technology and manufacturing global leader, with more than 120,000 employees in 100 countries around the world and has a demonstrated heritage of both innovation and achievement. 

Honeywell Aerospace is looking for a Capital Buyer to join the Romanian office in Bucharest!


The Capital Buyer, within the ISC (integrated supply chain) Indirect Procurement organization, will report solid line to the Capital Senior Manager for Capital Center of Excellence and is responsible for all aspects related to the purchase of Direct and Indirect Capital purchases. 
The Buyer thoroughly understands and adheres to Honeywell sourcing policies/ procedures and Code of Conduct.

In this role, you will be:

•	Performing all procurement activities
•	be proficient with electronic purchasing systems
•	negotiating with suppliers, and analyzing total costs and will protect the Company's interests by reviewing and utilizing appropriate contract terms and conditions and contract templates
•	Completing in-depth price analyses, marketplace surveys, and sole and single-source justifications
•	Developing formal negotiation plans
•	Implementing quality requirements and resolves exceptions to terms and conditions. Transactions may exceed $100,000 with a high level of complexity being exhibited on a portion of assignments
•	Effectively interacting with multiple departments at all levels of internal and external organizations
•	Professionally resolving problems in a fair and ethical manner. 
•	Assisting the Sourcing Manager in driving all indirect goals & initiatives, and will recommend actions to meet goals and initiatives
•	Administering purchase orders
•	Purchasing order placement
•	Supporting internal customer requirements
•	Ensuring equitable opportunity for qualified suppliers
•	E-Sourcing (RFx and e-Auctioning events)
•	Analyzing competitive bids and formulate purchase recommendation
•	Comparing/ evaluating procurement cost
•	Controlling costs and obtaining savings by using target pricing, reverse auctions, negotiations, and market tests
•	Conducting Price/ Cost Analysis
•	Consulting with Commodity Leaders to identify cost savings projects/ opportunities
•	Meeting or exceeding established goals and objectives
•	Other duties and responsibilities as may be assigned by management, 100% tactical 



If you have:
•	Bachelor's degree from an Accredited University in business or technical field
•	2-3 years procurement experience in goods and services buying
•	Proficiency working with MS Office Tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
•	Excellent written and verbal English (German or Czech communication skills are considered a great plus)

The following are desirable qualifications:
•	Working knowledge of purchasing procedures, concepts, products, services and strategic supplier management
•	Contracts negotiation experience
•	Green belt or lean certification
•	E-Auction experience
•	Capital experience
•	Casting and Machining Knowledge
•	Direct and/ or Indirect purchasing experience

Then, join us!
